## Installation

You can install `ddd` by using:

```{r, echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("tidylab/ddd")
```

Optionally, you can make a project independent of the `ddd` package by calling
`use_ddd()`. `ddd` is needed for software development and has no added value in
production. `use_ddd()` will copy the necessary R classes and functions into
your project.
